moduleMetadataJson.name: SSH Login Check Scanner
moduleMetadataJson.description:
This module will test ssh logins on a range of machines and
        report successful logins.  If you have loaded a database plugin
        and connected to a database this module will record successful
        logins and hosts so you can track your access.
author: todb <todb@metasploit.com>

options.name: WORKSPACE
options.description: Specify the workspace for this module

options.name: VERBOSE
options.description: Whether to print output for all attempts

options.name: USERNAME
options.description: A specific username to authenticate as

options.name: PASSWORD
options.description: A specific password to authenticate with

options.name: USER_FILE
options.description: File containing usernames, one per line

options.name: PASS_FILE
options.description: File containing passwords, one per line

options.name: USERPASS_FILE
options.description: File containing users and passwords separated by space, one pair per line

options.name: BRUTEFORCE_SPEED
options.description: How fast to bruteforce, from 0 to 5

options.name: BLANK_PASSWORDS
options.description: Try blank passwords for all users

options.name: USER_AS_PASS
options.description: Try the username as the password for all users

options.name: DB_ALL_CREDS
options.description: Try each user/password couple stored in the current database

options.name: DB_ALL_USERS
options.description: Add all users in the current database to the list

options.name: DB_ALL_PASS
options.description: Add all passwords in the current database to the list

options.name: STOP_ON_SUCCESS
options.description: Stop guessing when a credential works for a host

options.name: REMOVE_USER_FILE
options.description: Automatically delete the USER_FILE on module completion

options.name: REMOVE_PASS_FILE
options.description: Automatically delete the PASS_FILE on module completion

options.name: REMOVE_USERPASS_FILE
options.description: Automatically delete the USERPASS_FILE on module completion

options.name: TRANSITION_DELAY
options.description: Amount of time (in minutes) to delay before transitioning to the next user in the array (or password when PASSWORD_SPRAY=true)

options.name: MaxGuessesPerService
options.description: Maximum number of credentials to try per service instance. If set to zero or a non-number, this option will not be used.

options.name: MaxMinutesPerService
options.description: Maximum time in minutes to bruteforce the service instance. If set to zero or a non-number, this option will not be used.

options.name: MaxGuessesPerUser
options.description: Maximum guesses for a particular username for the service instance. Note that users are considered unique among different services, so a user at 10.1.1.1:22 is different from one at 10.2.2.2:22, and both will be tried up to the MaxGuessesPerUser limit. If set to zero or a non-number, this option will not be used.

options.name: CreateSession
options.description: Create a new session for every successful login

options.name: InitialAutoRunScript
options.description: An initial script to run on session creation (before AutoRunScript)

options.name: AutoRunScript
options.description: A script to run automatically on session creation.

options.name: CommandShellCleanupCommand
options.description: A command to run before the session is closed

options.name: RHOSTS
options.description: The target host(s), range CIDR identifier, or hosts file with syntax 'file:<path>'

options.name: THREADS
options.description: The number of concurrent threads (max one per host)

options.name: ShowProgress
options.description: Display progress messages during a scan

options.name: ShowProgressPercent
options.description: The interval in percent that progress should be shown

options.name: RPORT
options.description: The target port

options.name: SSH_IDENT
options.description: SSH client identification string

options.name: SSH_TIMEOUT
options.description: Specify the maximum time to negotiate a SSH session

options.name: SSH_DEBUG
options.description: Enable SSH debugging output (Extreme verbosity!)

options.name: Proxies
options.description: A proxy chain of format type:host:port[,type:host:port][...]

options.name: GatherProof
options.description: Gather proof of access via pre-session shell commands
